title: Coverlet

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of cotton and wool, plain weave with plain interlacings of secondary binding warps and patterning wefts (beiderwand); edged with woven fringe; woven on loom with jacquard attachment.

artist_display:
Ephraim Hausman (American, 1813–1901)
United States, Pennsylvania, Lehigh County, Trexlertown
medium_display: Cotton and wool, plain weave with plain interlacings of secondary binding warps and patterning wefts (Beiderwand); edged with woven fringe; woven on loom with Jacquard attachment
inscriptions: Inscription: Made by E. Hausman  Trexler Town  Trexler Town  1868
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. William F. Drews
publication_history: Mildred Davison and Christa C. Mayer-Thurman, Coverlets: A Handbook on the Collection of Woven Coverlets in The Art Institute of Chicago, exh. cat. (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1973), 143, cat. 106.
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, American Coverlets, July 14–Oct. 14, 1973.

Art Institute of Chicago, Agnes Allerton Gallery, Coverlets from the Permanent Collection, Apr. 4–July 5, 1981.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, The American Bed and Its Coverings, Nov. 21, 1990–Mar. 31, 1991.

Art Institute of Chicago, American Art, gallery rotation, Sep. 28, 1995-Mar. 19, 1996.

Art Institute of Chicago, American Art, Gallery 179 rotation, Oct. 12, 1998-Feb. 4, 1999.

Art Insitute of Chicago, American Art, Gallery 179 rotation, Jan. 23-July 3, 2003.

Art Institute of Chicago, Folk Art Gallery, American Art, July 27, 2009-Jan. 21, 2010.
provenance_text: Mrs. William F. Drews, Chicago, IL, by 1972 [Incoming receipt RX8611, May 5, 1972, in curatorial object file, Textiles Department]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1972.
term_titles: weaving on loom with jacquard attachment
technique_titles: weaving on loom with jacquard attachment
